intro: Oxyanthus ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda star flower, is a flowering plant native to the montane forests of Uganda. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with woody stems and elliptical leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. Oxyanthus ugandensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
